channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14123] HBase Backup/Restore Phase 2
item.description: Phase 2 umbrella JIRA. See HBASE-7912 for design document and description.

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

comments.comment: First patch, incorporates (HBASE-14125, HBASE-14130, HBASE-14131, HBASE-14132, HBASE-14133)
According HBaseBackupRestore-Jira-7912-v6.pdf Phase 2 will introduce backups schedule feature. Didn't find JIRA for this feature.
We have already cron tool - no need to invent something similar.
Patch v2. Contains additional tests for delete/describe/show history etc.
Patch v3. Includes HBASE-14124.
Patch v4 contains HBASE-14137 and changes from code review: https://reviews.apache.org/r/36591/
Patch v5. Contains HBASE-14124.
I meant HBASE-14134.
Separate patch for Phase 2, based on recent Phase 1 (v36).
Patch v7 (includes MultiWAL support)

Can you put the patch on review board ?

Thanks
Hmm. HBASE-14030 is still in review mode. Let us wait until it is complete and committed.
HBASE-14123 is based on the recent HBASE-14030 patch (patch on top of a patch).
Rebased Phase 2 patch on the latest HBASE-14030 (v36).
v12 contains HBASE-15422
HBASE-15442
Is it possible to upload the patch onto review board ?

For Backup.proto :


+  required uint32 bandwidth = 15;

I think convention is to use long for bandwidth.
e.g.


hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/replication/regionserver/ReplicationSource.java:    long bandwidth = this.conf.getLong("replication.source.per.peer.node.bandwidth



-      String targetRootDir) throws IOException {

+      String targetRootDir, int workers, int bandwidth) throws IOException {

Suggest using long for bandwidth.


+    opt.addOption("n", true, "History length");

I don't see "h" or "n" taken in BackupDriver. Either one is more user friendly.

-1 overall

+        List<BackupImage> list = new ArrayList<BackupImage>();

+        list.add(manifest.getBackupImage());

+        List<BackupImage> depList = manifest.getDependentListByTable(table);

+        list.addAll(depList);

         TreeSet<BackupImage> restoreList =

-            new TreeSet<BackupImage>(manifest.getDependentListByTable(table));

+            new TreeSet<BackupImage>(list);

Consider constructing TreeSet and adding BackupImage's to it without using List.


+   public void cancelCopyJob(byte[] jobId) throws IOException {

...

+       if (job == null) {

+         LOG.error("No job found for " + id);

+         // should we throw exception

+       }

Should return type be boolean so that the caller knows whether the cancellation is effective ?


+     } catch (InterruptedException e) {

+       throw new IOException(e);

throw InterruptedIOException instead


+          { logDirs, tableNames[i].getNameAsString(), newTableNames[i].getNameAsString()/*,

+              "-Dwal.bulk.output=" + bulkOutputPath.toString() */};

Consider referring to WALPlayer#BULK_OUTPUT_CONF_KEY directly.

+    conf.setBoolean("hbase.loadincremental.validate.hfile", false);

Describe in release notes that hfile validation is turned off.


+      master.createTable(backupHTD, null, HConstants.NO_NONCE, HConstants.NO_NONCE);

+      LOG.info("Created "+ BackupSystemTable.getTableName()+" table");

+    } catch(TableExistsException e) {

+      e.printStackTrace();

Better check the existence of table before issuing table creation request.


-    Job job = Job.getInstance(conf, conf.get(JOB_NAME_CONF_KEY, NAME + "_" + inputDir));

+    Job job = Job.getInstance(conf, conf.get(JOB_NAME_CONF_KEY, NAME + "_" + System.currentTimeMillis()));

Keep the input dir in job name.
Please use EnvironmentEdgeManager.

Describe in release notes that hfile validation is turned off.

This does not look right.

Just skimming the patch, I noticed that this patch undoes some of my changed to the HBASE-14030, for example BackupSystemTable.java. Can you please revert those changes.

In offline discussions, my big concern on the review side was HBASE-15443 and HBASE-15442 and similar issues that touch the layout / file formats. Is there a way we can extract these changes and push them to the HBASE-14030 patch?

Do you have a write up that summarizes the backup layout, backup image and backup manifest contents? It is extremely important to get the backup file layout and structures right, so such a document will definitely help others get the overall picture. Also, we can see whether the new proposed layout plays nicely with this format or not.
Enis Soztutar let us finish (commit) Phase 1 first.

Can you please revert those changes?

Enis Soztutar, What changes? Can you past the code?

Enis Soztutar let us finish (commit) Phase 1 first.

The problem is that without looking at HBASE-15443 and HBASE-15442 changes together with phase 1, we cannot be finished with the layout and backup image / manifest serialization formats. That is why the patch review is not complete yet.

Enis Soztutar, What changes? Can you past the code?

BackupSystemTable.java changes that add the reference counting back, and undo's the Connection management.

Created:
https://reviews.apache.org/r/45729/
Ran all backup unit tests which passed - including the TestBackupDelete#testBackupDelete which was disabled in the patch (I enabled it).

There is discussion on how to reuse the distcp code from hadoop.

Can you list which fields are currently inaccessible if we choose to subclass ?

Take a look at CopyMapper. All methods are private except map(). We could use reflection to call private methods from subclass, but

CopyMapper.

static enum FileAction

{ SKIP, // Skip copying the file since it's already in the target FS APPEND, // Only need to append new data to the file in the target FS OVERWRITE, // Overwrite the whole file }

is not accessible from subclass at all and we need this enum in subclass as argument to RetriableFileCopyCopyCommand ctor.

Single line output of multiple backups is not readable for human.

All of our logs are single lines of multiple attributes. If it works there, why not here?

I like history more


his·to·ry

ˈhist(ə)rē/Submit

noun

1.

the study of past events, particularly in human affairs.

"medieval European history"

synonyms:	the past, former times, historical events, the olden days, the old days, bygone days, long ago, yesterday, antiquity; More

2.

the whole series of past events connected with someone or something.

"the history of Aegean painting"

In this case, it is neither of the above.

I'd think 'history' in a datastore would be all that ever happened but in this case you can delete 'history' by removing backups – full and incremental – so subsequent listings are no longer histories...

Formatting is off here:

SLF4J: Class path contains multiple SLF4J bindings.

Restore like backup needs defaults and example args.

Created HBASE-17156.

Some commercial db also use history
http://www.dba-db2.com/2012/08/db2-backup-history.html

Thats good enough precedent I'd say. Looking here, http://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPGG_10.5.0/com.ibm.db2.luw.admin.cmd.doc/doc/r0001991.html, it looks like the history "...Lists all events that are currently logged in the database history records." .. so would seem to allow cleanup/delete. Thanks. Ignore my remarks on 'history'...

Patch v40 contains the following fixes:

  1. Unification of command line tools argument names (HBASE-17134)
  2. Small fix in history command output (HBASE-17135)
  3. Fix logging message in LoadIncrementalHFiles (HBASE-17136)
  4. Reconsider rpc timeout calculation in backup restore operation - set it to default (HBASE-17146)
  5. Reduce logging in BackupLogCleaner (HBASE-17147)
  6. New API to create HFile.Reader without instantiating block cache (HBASE-17151)
  7. Use new HFile API to open reader w/o block cache being created (HBASE-17152)
  8. Progress: usage should describe that backupId is optional and command w/o backup id shows progress of a current backup session (HBASE-17154)
  9. Unify table list output format across backup / backup set commands (HBASE-17155)
  10. Restore usage command output formatting is off (HBASE-17156)
  11. Fixed white spaces all over the code
  12. BackupManager cleanup : removed not used code (private ExecutorService pool)
  13. BackupManager : connection management fix (manager does not close connection anymore)
  14. Refactoring: BackupManifest, removed most attributes.
  15. Refactoring: Builder class for BackupImage.
  16. BackupSystemTable.WALItem toString() fix (use Path.SEPARATOR instead of "/")
  17. BackupSystemTableHelper access modifier changed to package-private
  18. Refactoring: HBaseBackupAdmin changed to BackupAdminImpl
  19. BackupAdminImpl now throws UnsupportedOperationException instead on returning nulls for async operations.
  20. Refactoring: FullTableBackupClient and IncrementalTableBakupClient now extends abstract class TableBackupClient
  21. Refactoring: IncrementalBackupManager extends BackupManager
  22. MapReduceBackupCopyTask cleanup: removed zk mentioning from javadoc
  23. LogRollMasterProcedureManager: added class description
  24. LogRollRegionServerProcedureManager: javadoc fix
  25. RestoreServerUtil: recovered.edits fix (replaced with HConstant)
  26. ZKProcedureCoordinatorRpcs: revert IOException back to KeeperException
  27. HRegionServer: added getter for LogRoller
  28. TestBackupCommandLineTool.: defined common string as constants
  29. Moved all methods added to ProtobufUtil to shaded.ProtobufUtil
  30. Removed default ctors from FullTableBackupClient, IncrementalTableBackupClient and from RestoreClient
  31. Some cleanup in MockNoopMasterServices.

cc: Stack
